body.name: Crystal Magnesium Solid Stick Natural Deodorant, Non-Irritating Aluminum Free Deodorant for Men or Women, Safely and Effectively Fights Odor, Baking Soda Free, Coconut + Vanilla, 2.5 oz

features: Trusted Brand With New Magnesium Innovation: More than 30 years ago, we invented the original mineral salt deodorant. Today, we continue to lead mineral innovation with Magnesium, a naturally occurring element used as an alternative to aluminum, baking soda, and other potentially irritating, ineffective, toxic, or harmful ingredients. Magnesium deodorants also help to create an easy transition from conventional antiperspirant.

Smell Good Naturally: Crystal aluminum-free deodorant for women and men dries quickly and allows the body to function naturally without blocking pores. It’s non-irritating, dermatologist-tested to be hypoallergenic, and perfect for all skin types. Available in 5 different scents: Lavender + Rosemary, Coconut + Vanilla, Cucumber + Mint, Sea Salt + Sage, Charcoal + Tea.
Invisible, Non Staining & No Greasy Residue: Crystal magnesium deodorant provides 24-hour odor control without the mess, greasy residue, or white stains on skin and clothes!

Good Vibes Only: Crystal aluminum-free deodorant is vegan, cruelty-free, safe, and effective. We never test our 100% vegan deodorants on animals and use the cleanest, safest ingredients available. You will never find parabens, sulfates, phthalates, artificial fragrances, or colors here!

Crystal Cares: We are committed to the safety, health, and welfare of the people who use our products and the environment. We are proud to sponsor like-minded non-profit organizations like Breast Cancer Prevention Partners and The Gentle Barn to create a better world.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well for sensitive skin
reviews.reviewText: My skin is very sensitive and I’ve tried other name brand, expensive, natural deodorants that broke me out or didn’t help with odor. This is all I use now, it’s great for my sensitive skin and I don’t have the sour smell other natural deodorants gave me. I live in Texas and even in the summer this has awesome odor control.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’ve tried chemical free deodorants before and they never worked to keep me from smelling! I first found this at Sprouts and it is the BEST! I love that it has magnesium in it and the scent is very nice and subtle. It still smells terrific even after working out. Highly recommend and so happy to have found this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Long lasting deodorant, but poor value for the money (Updated)
reviews.reviewText: I switched to Magnesium-based deodorants about 3-3.5 years ago. I've tried several brands which were too coarse to apply or just didn't spread/too dry or hard, but instead caked onto the armpits of my t-shirt (Schmidt's charcoal). I've tried some that just didn't work worth a darn (Native, Tom's, and the Walmart copy of Tom's, Every Man Jack). I've tried Arm & Hammer's aluminum free deodorant (no magnesium though) and it didn't last long enough. Didn't smell that great either. The Tom's brand really stinks, so "deodorant" is a misnomer. It should be called "odor replacer."I've tried Nfuse mountain scent, although it didn't smell like a mountain spring. It's strong in scent and seems to work really well, but it's a gel and you smell it all day. I wanted a stick deodorant that applied smoothly like the Dove anti-perspirant deodorant I used to wear. Like Crystal, NFuse is too expensive.Ultimately I landed on Ivory and their hint of aloe scent. It applies on your body with the same consistency as any other deodorant stick, it lasts for a long time, and it smells good without being too strong. Their coconut scent's not bad either. It was under $5/stick until Bidenomics/massive inflation took effect. I order the Ivory Hint of Aloe 4 packs here on Amazon for about $23.I stumbled across Crystal on Amazon and decided to give the charcoal & tea tree scent a try. The tea tree smell is a little strong at first; I prefer the charcoal scent portion more. It glides on easy and 28 hours later, I still don't have any underarm BO. It's been very effective and the scent is good. I'll go for a bike ride later today and really test it out.My only knock on this product is the price. At $14.32/stick, it's not affordable and there are much cheaper and very effective alternatives. It may not be as expensive as those deodorant sticks you buy at the department store that match your cologne/after shave, but still very pricey. Going through a stick per month, even with inflation, I can buy a year's supply of Ivory magnesium deodorant in 4 packs for just under $69, before taxes. A year's supply of Crystal is $169, before taxes. If they could get the price down to even $7-$8, I'd give them a 5* rating and use it daily.UPDATE: This stuff works the best of any magnesium deodorant I've tried but it's a poor value. I'm not going to spring $14.32/deodorant stick for Crystal when I can buy Ivory sticks for $5.75/stick. That's 60% less money for a product that's 90+% as effective, with only the added hassle of remembering to put your shirt on first to keep it from leaving streaks on your clothes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The best natural deodorant!! I’ve been using it for 2 years and it’s awesome!!! It really works! No bad smell!!! It’s not a compromise for me at all, and I’ll never return to harmful antiperspirants! The Vanilla and Coconut is my favorite. I previously tried the cucumber one, and that one didn’t work for me as well: I did smell using that one, I guess the flavor matters!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Smells amazing but feels sticky
reviews.reviewText: This smells absolutely incredible and I didn't notice any BO but when I put it on it feels sticky. I also need to point out because I didn't realize but this won't help with sweat. I'm a massage therapist and 3.5 hrs into work I feel sweaty and gross. I didn't smell but I realized I can't do something that doesn't deal with sweat as well. If you don't work in a hot environment or sweat much, you may love this. I had no negative skin reactions and it really does smell awesome.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite scent
reviews.reviewText: This deodorant is great and I absolutely love this scent the best. I wish there was a body spray. Yes, you will sweat, but you don’t smell.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars I wanted to like it...but the SMELL
reviews.reviewText: I've tried so many different natural deodorants. I'm a loyal user of the original crystal deodorant, but I wanted something more like a traditional deodorant (though still gentle and minimal chemicals, etc.) for when I start to stink and need just a few more hours of stink-coverage until I can get to a shower. This deodorant was lightweight, comfortable, and caused zero skin issues for me. However, it smells horrid. I'm not even sure how to describe it other than damp and squishy. And that's before you put it on. Maybe it's just this particular "flavor," but it's a no for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Smells delicious, but not strong enough for workouts.
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a deodorant free of baking powder and aluminum at a reasonable price point and I found it. I am sensitive to natural deodorants, but I don't want all of the other stuff in my stick.It feels a little gummy when you first apply it, but I found it doesn't create any lingering issues.The charcoal/tea tree smells incredible and can't wait to try the other scents.It performs really well for normal everyday activity, but it fails to hold up against intense workouts. This is the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.
